story:
Let me transform this resume into a coherent story:

Meet a seasoned sales professional whose journey spans two decades in the dynamic world of sales and marketing. After graduating from The Citadel, The Military College of South Carolina, with a Business Administration degree in 1995, they embarked on what would become an impressive career trajectory.

Their story begins in 1997 when they joined as a Sales Representative, specializing in high-end plumbing, electrical, and lighting fixtures. In this role, they became known for their exceptional ability to connect with architects and contractors throughout the Charleston Trident area. Managing 50-60 accounts, they helped drive sales revenue to an impressive $20.4 million in 2006, achieving a remarkable 29.4% growth. Their performance consistently placed them in the top 5% of sales representatives nationwide, among 600+ peers.

In 2009, their success led to a promotion as Branch Manager, where they expanded their influence by managing approximately 100 accounts. Their leadership skills shone through as they trained and motivated staff while implementing strategies to enhance branch operations. Their exceptional performance continued, ranking #1 in sales and gross dollar profitability and maintaining a position in the top 2% for corporate sales performance.

Since 2011, they've taken on an even more specialized sales role, focusing on building strategic relationships with purchasing agents, engineers, and architects. Their approach combines technical expertise with strong negotiation skills, allowing them to secure both new business and develop existing accounts.

Throughout their career, they've maintained a reputation for professionalism, initiative, and attention to detail. Their technical prowess extends to modern business tools, including Microsoft Windows/Office XP suite, which they use to enhance their sales strategies and client presentations.

This is the story of a sales professional who hasn't just survived in the industry but has consistently thrived, adapting to changing markets while maintaining their position as a top performer at every stage of their career.
